critique: This document is an executive order appointing members to the Science Advisory Board. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power implications, federalism stance, national security vs. civil liberties balance, economic regulation impact, or social inclusion perspective based solely on this appointment. The order itself doesn't inherently lean liberal or conservative. It doesn't deal with immigration, expand executive power beyond appointments, or directly affect federalism. It has no bearing on national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
